title: Code Name: Dodger Mission 2: Cartel Kidnapping
features: Popular in good teen young adult spy books and novels!
"4 OUT OF 4 STARS! Fast-paced, action-packed, and well developed. Reminiscent of James Bond films and the
series. Reluctant and avid readers who enjoy teenage spy books and adventures will love reading this!"

“Who is the great CIA Agent, Artful Dodger? Tell me now, and I kill you quick.”CIA Case Officer Bob Cheney is kidnapped, and teen orphan Justin Reed—aka the Artful Dodger—tracks his newly-adoped father to a top secret smuggling base, where he is forced to match wits with the cartel family’s brilliant teen prodigy, Luis Ocho. But Luis’s stunning sister Kiara is another story. Is she falling for Justin, or is this just another one of Luis’s diabolical tricks to lure the “great Agent Dodger” to his demise? Once again, Justin is forced to rely on his old street smarts—and his new CIA training—to face a ruthless enemy.
Missions can be read in any order.
A Young Adult spy novel series for kids of all ages!
description: "4 OUT OF 4 STARS! The plot was fast-paced, action-packed, and well developed. Family, honor, smuggling, and people's pasts are but a few of the themes in this action-packed spy novel. Reminiscent of James Bond films and the Alex Rider series with a satisfying, believable ending, Auxier grabs the reader hook, line, and sinker. Reluctant and avid readers who enjoy teenage, fast-paced spy adventures will love reading this book."
is the second book in the series created by my first novel,

, and continues the story that is dearest to my heart.Written first-person by the lead character, the narrative puts you in the shoes of teen orphan Justin Reed.  Rebellious yet sincere, complex yet compelling, Justin is the adopted son of CIA Case Officer Bob Cheney.Full of more trademark action, humor, spy gadgets and nefarious evil-doers,
leaves off, as Justin tracks his kidnapped father to a secret drug cartel smuggling base in Mexico.I call it a
- a spy thriller, chock full of flying!So, fasten your seat belts, ladies and gentlemen. The ride's about to get rough!

"Who is the great CIA Agent, Artful Dodger? Tell me now, and I kill you quick." CIA Case Officer Bob Cheney is kidnapped, and teen orphan Justin Reed--aka the Artful Dodger--tracks his newly-adoped father to a top secret smuggling base, where he is forced to match wits with the cartel family's brilliant teen prodigy, Luis Ocho. But Luis's stunning sister Kiara is another story. Is she falling for Justin, or is this just another one of Luis's diabolical tricks to lure the "great Agent Dodger" to his demise? Once again, Justin is forced to rely on his old street smarts--and his new CIA training--to face a ruthless enemy.

Born in Phoenix, Arizona, Eric Auxier is a pilot by day, writer by night, and kid by choice.Never one to believe in working for a living, Mr. Auxier's past list of occupations include: Alaska bush pilot, freelance writer, mural artist, and pilot for a Caribbean seaplane operation.  He is now a captain for a major airline.Mr. Auxier has contributed to such publications as
. He is a graduate of Arizona State University (B.S. degree in Aeronautical Technology,) where he worked as a newspaper editor, staff reporter and columnist. He is currently a regular contributor to

and a columnist at NYCAviation.com. His blog, ADVENTURES OF CAP'N AUX (capnaux.com) is read by thousands worldwide.Father of two, Mr. Auxier makes his home in Phoenix, Arizona.Email Mr. Auxier: capnaux@gmail.comJoin the author's blog: capnaux.com
